revised_title: Measuring the Coefficient of Diffusion in Living Cells and Differentiating Cells
tldr: The authors developed a method to measure the rate of diffusion of stain and other substances into living cells, which can be used to differentiate between types of cells, including bacteria and blood cells. They determined that the rate of diffusion is affected by factors such as temperature, time, and the presence of certain substances, and they created an equation to calculate the coefficient of diffusion for each cell type.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
